intro: Mapania jongkindii, commonly known as the Jongkind's mapania, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Hainan in China. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth surface and dark green coloration. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
